name: Audit Name
identification_details: Is Hand hygiene performed (soap/water or hand sanitizer) prior to accessing supplies, handling vials and IV solutions, and preparing or administering medications?
vital_signs: Are Disposable gloves are worn according to Meitra policy/procedure?
surgery: Are Medications and supplies stored and prepared in a clean area on a clean surface?
complaints_communicated: Is it ensured that needles and syringes are stored in their original packaging/wrapper?  (They are not stored unwrapped as sterility cannot be assured)
intake: Is the Skin at the injection/insertion site prepared with the appropriate antiseptic which is allowed to dry on the skin?
output: Is it ensured that the injection site is not touched after skin antisepsis has been done?
allergies: Are Sterile, single use syringes always used for any type of injection or infusion? Manufacturer prefilled syringes are always used for only one patient.
medication: Are Needles, cannulas and syringes always used as single use (used for only one patient) and are never re-used on other patients or to access medications/solutions more than once?
diagnostic: Are Medications never administered from the same syringe or needle to more than one patient.  Changing the needle but not the syringe is unacceptable?
lab_results: Is it ensured that the sterile needle/cannula and/or syringe is removed from the packaging just prior to use ?  Storage of syringes removed from packaging (even with capped needle) is prohibited?
pending_investigation: Are Single-use or single-dose vials used whenever possible.  Single-dose (single-use) medication vials are only used for one patient.  Discard after one use
medicine_order: Are Entry into a medication vial always done with a new needle or cannula and syringe these items are single use only?  Never enter a vial with a syringe or needle that has been used
facility_communicated: Are the rubber septum/diaphragm of medication vials always cleansed using friction with alcohol prior to each entry?
health_education: Are Multi-dose vials dated when first opened and discarded within 28 days of opening or according to manufacturerâ€™s recommendations?
risk_assessment: Is it ensured that left over parenteral medications are never pooled or combined for later use?
urethral: Is it ensured that needles and cannulas are never left inserted in any vial rubber septum for multiple withdrawals?
bystander: Are Medication vials inspected prior to use and if sterility has been or is thought to be compromised (presence of particulate matter, discoloration, turbidity) it is ensured that the same is discarded?
instruments: Is it ensured that bags/bottles of IV solutions are never used as common source supply (i.e. flush solutions) for more than one patient?
sterile: Is it ensured that Infusion supplies such as needles, syringes, flush solutions, administration sets, IV fluids are never used for more than one patient.?
antibiotics: Is it ensured that there is restricted use of finger stick capillary blood sampling devices to individual patients?
surgical_site: Are single-use lancets that permanently retract upon puncture used and it is ensured that finger stick devices and lancets are never reused?
wound: Is it ensured that pen style devices with removable lancet are dedicated to one patient and lancets removed by patient or if by healthcare worker with mechanical means (hemostat) to avoid contact?
documented: Is it ensured that the exterior surface of glucometer are Cleaned and disinfected after each use, even if there is not visible blood/soil.Only use EPA registered disinfectant approved by Infection Control is used.
adequate_facilities: Are Needles/sharps disposed of at the point of use and containers are located conveniently in areas where sharps are used?
sufficient_lighting: Are Sharps disposal containers leak-proof, puncture-resistant and are white in color or labeled with a biohazard label?
storage_facility_for_food: Are Sharps containers emptied/replaced with 2/3 full or when the level is reached on the container?
personnel_hygiene_facilities: Are sharps containers are either wall mounted or otherwise stabilized so they will not tip over?
food_material_testing: Are sharps safety devices used where possible and activated immediately after use and prior to disposal?
incoming_material: Is air-conditioned storage available where required?
raw_materials_inspection: Is all food stored off the floor?
raw_materials_cleaning: Are transport containers and carts regularly cleaned?
equipment_sanitization: Are proper temperatures maintained during transport for hot foods?
vegetarian_and_non_vegetarian: Are food handlers' medical checkup records up to date?
cooked_food_cooling: Is Food Safety training regularly provided?
food_portioning: Are food samples preserved for 24 hours?
